data.question: What is the parent methylphosphine form mentioned in the text?
data.answer: MePH2

data.question: Which phosphine forms stable PH ylides under ambient conditions?
data.answer: Bis-(sulfonyl)methyl-substituted phosphines

data.question: What type of complexes can the anionic nature of the phosphines form?
data.answer: Zwitterionic complexes

data.question: Is the ylide tautomer H3P+CH2 more or less stable than its parent methylphosphine form?
data.answer: Less stable

data.question: What is the effect of carbanion-functionalization on phosphines?
data.answer: It leads to a switch from electron-poor to highly electron-rich phosphines with strong donor abilities and high basicities.

data.question: Do the phosphines react with electrophiles at the phosphorus atom or the carbanionic center?
data.answer: Phosphorus atom

data.question: What was the first detection of a PH ylide at ambient conditions?
data.answer: Bis(alkoxycarbonyl)methylphosphines C

data.question: Can the PH ylides undergo protonation at the phosphorus center?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What is the role of sulfonyl groups in the synthesis of stable PH ylides?
data.answer: They are ideal for the isolation of stable PH ylides due to their excellent anion-stabilizing ability.

data.question: What was the first structurally characterized example of a neutral acyclic PH ylide?
data.answer: 3 b-Cy

data.question: Does the solvent affect the equilibrium between CH and PH tautomer?
data.answer: Yes, the ylidic form is preferred in polar solvents.

data.question: What is the significance of the P1-C1 bond length in the PH ylides?
data.answer: It is considerably shorter than in common phosphines, indicating additional electrostatic attraction.

data.question: What was the outcome of treating the anionic phosphines with different electrophiles?
data.answer: Only a single product was formed with the electrophile attacking at the phosphorus center.

data.question: Are the carbanionic phosphines characterized by a high-field shift in the 31P NMR spectra?
data.answer: Yes

data.question: What was the first example of an acyclic phosphine exclusively existing in its PH ylide form?
data.answer: 3 b-Cy

data.question: Do the calculations confirm the preference of the ylide over the phosphine form?
data.answer: Yes, except for the diphenylphosphine system 3 a-Ph.

data.question: What was the effect of deprotonation on the donor strength of the phosphines?
data.answer: Deprotonation significantly increased the donor strength of the phosphines.

data.question: Was the zwitterionic gold complex active in catalysis without additional activation?
data.answer: Yes, it was active in the hydroamination of phenyl acetylene without requiring further activation.

data.question: What was the role of the carbanionic electron-donating substituent in the phosphines?
data.answer: It imparted a remarkable increase in donor strength and basicity.

data.question: Did the carbanionic phosphines exhibit exclusive phosphorus-centered reactivity?
data.answer: Yes, when treated with different electrophiles, the reaction occurred exclusively at the phosphorus center.
